item.title: My First Blog Post!
item.description: Python in R Reticulate I think one of the most cool Python thing that I learned this semester was using Python in RStudio. Itâ€™s interesting to see how you can interact with different languages in one platform, and the Reticulate package allows you to do just that! library(reticulate) a <- "Swag" b = 'money' print(r.a ,b) ## ('Swag', 'money') cat(c(a,py$b)) ## Swag money Computational Biology Context Another python use that I found was using it in the context of computational biology.
